adjective.description: Erring or straying from the proper course or standards.
examples: he could never forgive his daughter's errant ways

origin: Middle English (in errant (sense 2)): errant (sense 1) from Latin errant- erring, from the verb errare; errant (sense 2) from Old French errant traveling, present participle of errer, from late Latin iterare go on a journey, from iter journey. Compare with arrant.
